name: Dirk Arnold
content: Dirk Arnold Dirk V. Arnold Faculty of Computer Science Dalhousie University Halifax, Nova Scotia Canada B3H 4R2 Phone : 902.494.2691 Email : dirk@dal.ca Curriculum Vitae Research My research is in evolutionary computation. My current work focuses on constraint handling and on the use of surrogate modelling techniques. I also have research interests in neighbouring areas of optimization and machine learning. A complete listing of publications can be found below or on my Google scholar page. Teaching In 2025/26 I teach the following courses: CSCI 1300: Calculus in Computer Science (Fall term) CSCI 2360: Probability and Statistics for Computer Science (Winter term) CSCI 3162: Digital Media (Winter term) Course matrials and further information are available on Brightspace.
